summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding a grand jury subpoena issued to an individual (name redacted) in the Southern District of New York's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutor seeks flight/travel records from 2000 onward, observations of young women/girls on flights, discussions with Epstein about his relationships with young women, and identities of Epstein's employees.

persons.name: KCassidy
persons.context: Email recipient at the law firm Hafetz Necheles, involved in communication regarding a subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein'; the investigation concerns his relationships with young women or girls and related legal issues.

connections.description: KCassidy is representing an individual (redacted) who received a grand jury subpoena in connection with the Epstein investigation, indicating a legal relationship to the case.

events.title: Subpoena Return Date
events.description: Original return date for a grand jury subpoena issued to an individual in the Epstein investigation, which prosecutors are prepared to hold in abeyance.

events.title: Prosecutor Follow-up on Subpoena
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney follows up on a phone conversation, detailing the information sought via subpoena: flight records from 2000, observations of young women/girls on flights, discussions with Epstein about his relationships, and identities of Epstein's employees.

keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to an individual (name redacted) in the Epstein investigation, seeking flight manifests, plans, and travel records dating back to 2000.
Prosecutors are interested in observations of young women or girls on flights and any discussions with Jeffrey Epstein about his relationships with young women or his related legal issues.
The investigation seeks to identify Epstein's employees and staff, both current and previous, from the subpoenaed individual.
The prosecutor offered to hold the subpoena return date of July 22, 2019, in abeyance in anticipation of a proffer or voluntary interview.
